page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: Situated to the N.and N.W. of the town centre,this is a balance of urban and rural land use. Served now by the A449,A41 and main rail lines to the North and West,the presence of a canal network indicates former industry within the area.Present industry includes tyres at Goodyear,UK. and many small firms. The Racecourse and Stadium attract national interest;2 golf courses provide local recreation. A traditional shopping centre at Tettenhall contrasts with modern purpose-built shops at e.g. Three Tuns. Housing also varies,from small terraced town houses at Dunstall to detached luxuary homes of Stockwell End.A new community has developed on the former Wolverhampton Aerodrome,Pendeford. Farmland is dominated by grassland within this area.
